Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P. Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF375 & 16CM22 called at 3:14 pm [sf] 
Defendant Michael P. Alexander in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney Lippert submitts plea questionnaire and criminal case settlement.
Court and parties discuss criminal case settlement and restitution amount beign different from the criminal case settlement. Restitution amount being requested by Accidental Fund Holdings, Inc.is $3,693.18.
ADA Shock advises that he filed an amended information on this case that joins that charges in 15CF375 & 16CM22, but is unsure if the defendant has been arraigned on the amended information.

Arraignment:
Service of Amended Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 & Count # 4 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 & #3.

Attorney Lippert motions the Court to schedule sentencing out approximately 30 days.
ADA Shock does not object to setting sentencing out, would like sentencing be set sooner than 30 days.
Court advises the defendant that bond and bond conditions continue.
Defendant indicates that he would like to go to sentencing today and then delay his report date.

ADA Shock presents sentencing recommendation.
ADA Shock advises that he has a DVD that he would like to play.
Court and parties discuss the DVD, parties agree that the Court Reporter does not need to take down the audio of the DVD, but that the Court will keep a copy for the record.
ADA Shock indicates that the start time on the DVD is 26:59 and the stop time is 27:46.
DVD marked as State's Exhibit #1.
ADA Shock submitts victim impact statements and verifies that the State has victim rights compliance.
Attorney Lippert presents sentencing argument.

On Count #1:
Court sentences Mr. Alexander to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence August 15, 2016 by 6:00 pm

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 5 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Any assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees, assessment and surcharges (to include DNA Surcharge)
--To pay restitution of $3693.18 payable to Accidental Fund Holdings Inc.
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

On Count #4:
--serve 4 months jail, to be served in the prison system;  to commence consecutive to Count #1
--To pay statutory costs, fees, and surcharges to be converted to civil judgment

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court orders bond to remain in effect until defendant reports.
recess: 4:04 pm
for Return of Property - 1991 GMC Sierra Pickup Truck to Michael P. Alexander
for Return of Property - Defendant's

Defendant Michael P. Alexander in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ informs the Court that the State has no objection to Return of Property, the only request is that law enforcement is given sufficient time to photograph and document items, maybe a couple weeks.
Arguments by Atty Lippert for return of property today or in a matter of days as law enforcement has had the property since November of 2015
Response by DA Happ, including request for one week
Court grants motion and directs Atty Lippert to draft order directing them to preserve evidence as soon as practicable but no later than noon on 7/18/16, running by DA Happ today and noting her non-objection to order. Court informs Atty Lippert that he can serve order on Watertown PD.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #15CF375 and #16CM22 called at 2:57pm. 
Defendant Michael P. Alexander in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court addresses the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond in Case 15CF375.
ADA Beck does not object to the Motion.  
The Court grants the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond:  the Bond in Case #15CF375 is modified so that the condition that Mr. Alexander is not to drive a motor vehicle now has an exception that Mr. Alexander may operate a motor vehicle for work purposes--he may travel to and from home to work, and he may drive to do what his employer wants him to do, and a further exception is that Mr. Alexander may drive to get back and forth to court date appearances. 

ADA Beck requests that the felony case be set for trial.  ADA Beck alerts the Court and Defense that the State intends to file a joinder motion. 
recess 3:10pm.

Case called at 8:50 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Michael P. Alexander in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews for the record that Atty Penwell is currently appointed to Mr. Alexander; case is scheduled for arraignment, but Atty Penwell is currently suspended and Atty Dade has not appeared.
Mr. Alexander informs the Court that Atty Dade indicated that he would not appear today.

Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Alexander indicates that he does not wish to have alternate counsel appointed and does not wish to have Atty Penwell continue. 
Court has further colloquy with Mr. Alexander and he requests to continue pro se and attempt to come to agreement with DAs office
Court reviews right to counsel. Mr. Alexander waives this right; Court accepts this waiver and finds him competent to represent himself. Court informs Mr. Alexander that if he changes his mind about wanting counsel he needs to inform the Court ASAP, as he could waive his right to represenation. Constructive waiver of counsel warnings given. 

Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered
Court removes Atty Penwell from case
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Mt. Alexander addresses letter re: request to amend bond
Court inquires as to why the bond should be amended and why the bond should be amended 
ADA Hall indicates that she is not prepared to address bond - unsure why there is a request to not drive, would need to consult with assigned prosecutor
Mr. Alexander presents basis as to bond amendment - Court informs ADA Hall to relay information to ADA Shock and It will schedule matter next week
Recess: 9:11 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule Motion Hearing on Bond Modification 12/21/15 at 1:15 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule DA PTC 1/13/16 at 3:20 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 1/29/16 at 1:15 pm - Send notices

[MK] case called at 10:08am. 
Defendant Michael P. Alexander in court with Attorney John Dade (for Attorney C. Bennett Penwell).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Information admitted.
This case is scheduled for Arraignment today, however the Defense files a Request for Substitution of Judge. 
The Courts finds the Request for Substitution to be in the proper form and timely.
The Court directs the clerk to take action to arrange for the assignment of a new Judge to preside over the case.
Attorney Dade requests that the Order Appointing Attorney Penwell be cancelled, indicating that Mr. Alexander wishes to proceed without Court-appointed counsel.  Mr. Alexander wishes to act as his own attorney, and to be able to speak directly with the assigned District Attorney. 
The Court refers this issue of Court-appointed Counsel to the next assigned Judge.
Mr. Alexander voices his affirmation that he requests to have Attorney Penwell removed as appointed counsel.  
recess 10:11am.
Arraignment at 11-24-2015 10:00 am
Bond Payment Information
Consent to Act as appointed attorney signed by Attorney Penwell
Conflict Review Worksheet - No Conflict Found
Scheduling Notice
Amended

Case called at 10:32am [mo]
Defendant Michael P. Alexander in court with Attorney Charles Bennett Penwell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney/Assistant District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute/ADA Wambach did Mr. Alexander. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Officer Ryan Abbott -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock 
--cross examination by Attorney Penwell
Arguments given by Atty. Penwell 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Alexander committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Atty. Penwell requests that Arraignment be scheduled at a later date; suggests 11/24/15 at 10:00am.
The Court schedules the Arraignment 
ADA Shock submits the Information

Atty. Penwell requests that the Mr. Alexander bond be modified to allow travel out of Jefferson County
--no objection from ADA Shock
The Court modifies Mr. Alexander's bond to remove the condition of not to leave Jefferson County and adds the condition to not leave the State of Wisconsin or the State of Michigan

Atty. Penwell requests that Mr. Alexander's bond condition regarding ability to drive be modified
--ADA Shock objects; gives arguments
The Court denies this request. 

ADA Shock requests that Mr. Alexander's CASH bond be increased; arguments given
--Attorney Penwell gives arguments in opposition
--Questioning by the Court
The Court denies the State's request to increase CASH bail. 
recess: 11:25am 

NEXT:  Arraignment on 11/24/15 at 10:00am

Case called at 1:17pm [mo]
[Commissioner Onheiber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Michael P. Alexander appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (For BOND purposes).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Alexander is not eligible for SPD representation. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel 

The Court requires a $1000 CASH bond, with conditions:
--No operation of a motor vehicle
--Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--Mr. Alexander may NOT leave Jefferson County or any County contiguous/attached to Jefferson County
--Booking at JESO today

Speedy Preliminary Hearing DEMANDED by the State. 

The Court inquires of Mr. Alexander of his income and expenses to determine eligibility for Court Appointed Counsel
The Court finds that Mr. Alexander IS eligible for Court Appointed Counsel. 
The Court appoints Attorney Penwell as Counsel for Mr. Alexander.

recess 1:40 pm.
